message.content:
The biggest challenges teenagers in Finland face can be categorized into several areas. One challenge is the pressure to perform well academically. The Finnish education system is highly regarded globally, and students are expected to excel and meet high standards. This can lead to stress, competition, and anxiety among teenagers.

Another challenge is mental health issues. Finland has seen an increase in mental health problems, including depression and anxiety, among teenagers. Factors such as societal expectations, social media influences, and the pressure to fit in can contribute to these issues.

Substance abuse is also a concern. While the overall alcohol and drug consumption rates among teenagers in Finland have decreased in recent years, it remains a challenge for some. Peer pressure and the perception of alcohol as a significant part of Finnish culture can contribute to substance abuse problems among teenagers.

Bullying is a significant challenge as well. Despite various efforts to combat bullying, it still occurs in Finnish schools, both physically and online. As a result, some teenagers may face social exclusion, lowered self-esteem, and psychological distress.

Finally, the transition from adolescence to adulthood and career choices can be a challenge for Finnish teenagers. Deciding on future paths and making important life decisions can create stress and uncertainty among teenagers, as they must navigate between societal expectations and personal aspirations.
